description: Collection of memorable quotes, one-liners, and wisdom from Sajith Pai's writings
pmf_quotes: PMF is like love, you'll know it when you have it - this is WRONG. PMF needs a systematic framework.
PrePMF startups are a learning machine, not an earning machine
Before you go big, you need to get it right. This is what PMF is.
PMF is effectively the nailing before the scaling
The biggest error founders make is confusing PPF for PMF, then pouring on GTM fuel prematurely
Focus on the monkey, not the pedestal! Solve for the hardest thing first!
Uncomfortably narrow personas addressed by one hero channel through a sharp message is how first-time MMF is achieved
Believe what they do, not what they tell
PMF can come and go (ask Paytm's Wallet team or the Clubhouse guys)
PMF = PPF + MMF (Product-to-Problem Fit + Motion-to-Market Fit)
PMF = GRUE (Growth with Retention and Unit Economics)
Getting to CM2+ is a good shorthand for getting to PMF
strategy_quotes: Where you play is more important than how you play
Strategy is about choices and tradeoffs around where to play and how to win
The first time founder thinks product while the second time founder thinks distribution
The best founders think of product and distribution as joined at the hip
tam_quotes: TAM in itself is not very useful, but THINKING about TAM is extremely useful
Like Eisenhower on plans: 'Plans are worthless, but planning is everything'
Best founders go beyond TAM to look at TEM (Total Expandable Market)
india_ecosystem_quotes: India is not one but three Indias (India1, India2 and India3)
Much of our consumption is driven by India1 (<10% population but 40% of spends)
It is not easy for India1 startups to expand to India2 or vice versa
Finding PMF in India1 doesn't mean automatic fit in India2
The next wave of global startups are emerging out of India
vc_investor_quotes: Early stage valuations aren't really valuations. They are the exhaust fumes of a negotiation about two things â€” the amount raised and the ownership percentage
Nailing capital vs scaling capital - know the difference
The best VCs are long, preloaded, context windows for their founders
I am greedy to be part of ambitious founder journeys, and help inflect them to greatness
founder_wisdom: The founders who select me to be part of their journeys pick me to be their PMF coach, sparring partner, 11pm friend
Offer a safe space for founders to think aloud on their challenges, and help them get to a solution
The three jobs of a startup CEO: Prioritisation, Hiring, Fundraising - in that order
product_wisdom: Don't overbuild the product at this stage. Time is money.
Break down assumptions into modular components and test hard things first
Believe what customers do, not what they tell
Product-market-GTM-team - the Congruent Square needs alignment
unit_economics_quotes: CM2+ (CM2 positive) is a key goal that early stage startups should strive for
Getting to CM2+ is integrally linked with getting to PMF
S&M costs should be 1/3rd of contribution margin
learning_quotes: There are 3 routes on how the best founders drive learnings: Customer interactions, Hiring process, Fundraising conversations
There is extremely high alpha in startup/tech podcasts vs other content formats
I like to read, think about and write on tech, business, culture and their intersections
pivot_wisdom: As far as possible, pivot on the market, not the product
It's much harder to change product to fit market; vice versa is what you're seeking
With 18 months runway per raise, you have at most 1 market pivot and 1 product pivot
